Class AbstractLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.uiDesigner.core.AbstractLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.LayoutManager, java.awt.LayoutManager2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GridLayoutManager, XYLayoutManager

    public abstract class AbstractLayout
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.LayoutManager2

    • Method Detail

      • getMargin

        public final java.awt.Insets getMargin()

      • getHGap

        public final int getHGap()
        Returns:
        current own value of horizontal gap between columns. If horizontal gap isn't defined then the method returns -1.

      • getHGapImpl

        protected static int getHGapImpl(java.awt.Container container)
        Returns:
        horizontal gap (if it's defined in the layout) or traverses the container hierarchy to find "inherited" HGAP property. Note, that the method always return positive value.

      • setHGap

        public final void setHGap(int hGap)
        Parameters:
        hGap - new horizontal gap. If hGap is -1 then own gap is not defined and it should be inherited from parent container.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if hGap is less then -1

      • getVGap

        public final int getVGap()
        Returns:
        current own value of vertical gap between rows. If vertical gap isn't defined then the method returns -1.

      • getVGapImpl

        protected static int getVGapImpl(java.awt.Container container)
        Returns:
        horizontal gap (if it's defined in the layout) or traverses the container hierarchy to find "inherited" HGAP property. Note, that the method always return positive value.

      • setVGap

        public final void setVGap(int vGap)
        Sets new vertical gap between rows
        Parameters:
        vGap - new vertical gap. If vGap is -1 then own gap is not defined and it should be inherited from parent container.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if vGap is less then -1
